society.ponder.tag.ember_machines.descri: Ember machines, upgrades, and other constructs
society.ponder.tag.ember_power.descripti: Components used for generating, transporting, and storing Ember power
society.ponder.tag.biomancy.description: Tutorials for summoning flesh and using it
society.ponder.tag.aetherworks.descripti: Harnessing the power of Ember and the moon
society.ponder.tag.ember_fluid_managemen: Components used for transporting, managing, or creating fluids
society.ponder.tag.cooking_brewing.descr: Tutorials for complex cooking & brewing machines
kubejs.ponder.aether_forge_scene_one.tex: The Aetherium Forge is a structure that harnesses heat for crafting.
The top and bottom portions of the Aetherium Forge receive Ember power.
Crafting stations that use heat are placed on the base of the Forge.
A Forge Dial is needed to monitor the heat level of the Forge.
kubejs.ponder.aether_forge_scene_three.t: The Aetherium Forge can be cooled down in two different ways.
Aetherium Forge Heat Vents will add constant cooling to the Forge.
It only requires a redstone signal to operate.
The Aetherium Forge Cooler instantly drops the temperature of the Forge. It must be placed over Ice.
It needs Ember power and a constant supply of water to operate.
When given a redstone pulse, the Forge Cooler will instantly remove 500 heat from the Forge and consume the Ice.
kubejs.ponder.aether_forge_scene_two.tex: The Aetherium Forge utilizes Heat as its main crafting mechanic.
An Aetherium Forge Heater raises the temperature of the Forge. It must be placed over Lava.
It needs Ember power and a constant supply of water to operate.
The Aetherium Forge Heater will only provide heat when it has a redstone signal.
The Aetherium Forge will explode if the temperature stays at 3000.
A Comparator can be attached to a Forge Dial to get its temperature as a redstone signal.
Clever redstone can be used to keep the Aetherium Forge at a certain level.
The alchemy process is a complex way to craft the highest tier of items in Embers.
To start, place an Alchemy Pedestal for each needed ingredient around the Tablet.
Additionally, a Beam Cannon will need to point to the Tablet and be supplied with Ember Power.
You will also need a way to send a redstone signal to the Beam Cannon to trigger the craft.
kubejs.ponder.alchemy_tablete_scene_thre: Figuring out alchemy recipes can be tedious, but luckily there are tools to help.
A Codebreaking Slate should be one of the first items you make.
It stores multiple Alchemical Wastes, with a UI that makes tracking attempts easy.
The Mnemonic Inscriber can be attached to your Exchange Tablet and filled with paper.
After a successful alchemy recipe, it will inscribe the recipe in paper for your records.
The Entropic Enumerator allows two Aspecti to be attached to the incorrect item...
But has a set chance to fail the recipe, correct or incorrect.
The alchemy process is based on the game Mastermind. If all else fails, there are places you can find solvers...
The alchemical process requires some experimentation. It's recommended to start with a cheap recipe.
Glowing dots indicate an Aspectus is paired with the correct item...
While pale dots indicate the Aspectus exists in the recipe, but is paired with the incorrect item.
With your new guess, give the Beam Cannon another go.
Note: Alchemy recipes are randomized per world, so this configuration may not work for you!
If the recipe is correct, all the pedestal items will be consumed, and you'll have your item!
In this example, we will be crafting an Intelligent Apparatus.
In JEI you can see the recipe may contain a Copper, Lead, and Silver Aspectus.
Place an Aspectus on each of the Alchemy Pedestals at random. One of them will be a duplicate.
Next, place the recipe items on each one of the pedestals...
And the catalyst on the Exchange Tablet.
With everything placed, give the Beam Cannon a redstone Signal.
If the recipe is incorrect, the catalyst will turn to Alchemical Waste and random items on the pedestals will be consumed.
Right clicking with the Alchemical Waste in your hand will give you hints on where the Aspecti go.
kubejs.ponder.baker_station_scene_one.te: The Caking Station is the work table for preparing cakes, cookies, and cupcakes.
To start, place cake dough on top of the station
To make cupcakes, any kind of knife can be used to cut the cake.
For cookies, roll down the cupcake dough using a rolling pin.
Frosting can be added at any stage of the caking process.
The cakes can then be harvested with an empty hand.
Cakes must be sliced before being eaten.
The Biomechanical Forge is a machine for automating most Bio-Forge recipes. It requires a multiblock behind it to function.
Its base layer is made up of Primal Flesh.
Its second layer is made up of Primal Flesh Walls, and and Bloomlight.
The third layer is made up of Primal Flesh Walls, Slabs and a Bloomlight.
The final layer is made up of Flesh Spikes and a Bio-Forge.
kubejs.ponder.bottler_build.text_1: The Bottler is a multiblock machine for putting fluids in Bottles or Buckets.
kubejs.ponder.bottler_build.text_2: Its base layer is made up of Sealed Wood Kegs and a fluid hopper.
kubejs.ponder.bottler_build.text_3: Its second layer is made up of a Metal Former and a Fluid Vessel.
kubejs.ponder.bottler_build.text_4: Its final layer is made up of Fluid Pipes.
kubejs.ponder.brewingstation_scene_one.t: The Brewingstation is a multiblock machine for brewing beers and spirits.
To start, place your ingredients into the basin and fill with water.
Place your fuel in the oven block to begin brewing.
kubejs.ponder.brewingstation_scene_three: There are three tiers of Brewingstation:
Wooden is the starter tier, and can only brew beers.
Copper is the second tier, capable of brewing spirits and beers.
It can be purchased from the Gourmand decree.
Netherite is the final tier. It can brew every drink, and the brewing minigame is optional.
kubejs.ponder.brewingstation_scene_two.t: The brewing process is an active one, and the faster you fix issues in the brewing, the higher output you'll get.
The basin needs a constant supply of water, and sometimes drains
The basin may also overflow, requiring you to take out some water
Like the basin, the oven portion may run out of fuel
Finally, the timer portion of the brewingstation may need to be reset with a right click
Once finished, you can take your beer out with a Beer Mugs!
kubejs.ponder.charger_one.text_1: The Copper Charger fills portable Ember containers with Ember Power.
kubejs.ponder.charger_one.text_2: It needs Ember power to operate, and can receive it from any side.
kubejs.ponder.charger_one.text_3: It can charge Mantle Bulbs, Jars, and Cartridges.
kubejs.ponder.charger_one.text_4: The Copper Charger will invert its behavior and discharge items when an Ember Siphon is placed below it.
kubejs.ponder.crucible_scene.text_1: The crucible is an interactive way to craft items. It needs to be placed over a heat source and filled with water.
kubejs.ponder.crucible_scene.text_2: Each recipe is broken down into steps. After tossing in your items, if a step is completed correctly the Crucible water color will change and a sound will play.
kubejs.ponder.crucible_scene.text_3: Some recipes will require stirring during steps. This can be done by right clicking with an empty hand.
The Dawnstone Anvil is a tool for upgrading, repairing, and breaking down tools and armors.
To start, place the tool you want to work on top of it.
To break down the item into its repair material, hold right click on it with the Tinker's Hammer.
This may take a while to do manually...
Tools can be repaired using their repair material, or Isolated Materia.
Tools and Armors can be upgraded to receive Heat by using an Ancient Motive Core.
As you use the tool more, the Heat bar on the tooltip will fill up.
The Inferno Forge can be used to upgrade the Heat level once filled. You can then add upgrades in the same way.
The Automatic Hammer is an upgrade for the Dawnstone Anvil that hammers for you.
It requires Ember power in order to run.
Place your tool and any other items on the Dawnstone Anvil like usual.
Send a redstone pulse to trigger the Automatic Hammer.
kubejs.ponder.dehydrator_build.text_1: The Dehydrator is a multiblock machine for automating Silo recipes. It requires a multiblock behind it to function.
kubejs.ponder.dehydrator_build.text_2: Its base layer is made up of Bricks and a Block of Dawnstone.
kubejs.ponder.dehydrator_build.text_3: The next three layers are made up entirely of Copper Silos.
The Ember Activator turns Ember Crystals into Ember Power.
The bottom portion of the Activator receives Ember Crystals & Shards.
Ember can be extracted from the top using an Ember Emitter.
Make sure your Ember Emitter has a redstone signal to extract!
Turning Ember Grit Into Ember Power
Normally the Ember Activator cannot use the Ember Grit your bore produces.
Placing a Heat Exchanger next to the base of the Ember Activator lets it consume Ember Grit for 300 Ember....
At the cost of multiplying all output by 0.9.
kubejs.ponder.ember_bore_scene_one.text_: The Ember Bore mines Ember Shards, Crystals, and Grit using Furnace fuels.
To start mining Ember, place the bore, making sure it touches at least 3 blocks of Bedrock.
Other recipes may have different requirements, so check JEI for info.
To put fuels in and take items out of the Bore, you'll need a Mechanical Core.
Any Furnace fuel can be used to power the bore. They can be supplied using a Hopper or Item Pipe.
Ember Shards, Crystals, and Grit can be piped out of the Mechanical Core using an Item Extractor and Item Pipe.
Make sure your Item Extractor has a redstone signal to extract!
kubejs.ponder.ember_bore_scene_three.tex: Not every place you drill for Ember will give you equal yield.
The Atmospheric Gauge is a placeable item that measures the current Ember Density of a position.
The Field Chart is an advanced block that shows Ember Density in a large area.
kubejs.ponder.ember_bore_scene_two.text_: With the Excavation Buckets upgrade, the Ember Bore can dig for Gravel and Flint or Snow.
Connect the upgrade to any port on the Mechanical Core to start.
Make sure at least 5 of the blades are touching the block you want to mine.
kubejs.ponder.ember_injector_scene_one.t: The Ember Injector is a device that enables Crystal Seeds to grow into metals.
Place a Crystal Seed of any type on the side the Ember Injector is facing.
These can be found in world inside of small ruins, or purchased from the Shady Wizard.
The Ember Injector needs Ember power to operate, and can receive it from any side.
As it receives Ember power, the Crystal Seed shards will slowly grow...
And drop its corresponding metal nuggets in the world.
As the Crystal Seed refines, it will drop more and more nuggets with every cycle.
Its level will not be saved when broken, so keep it in a safe permanent place.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_one.text_1: Fluid Pipes are a simple yet powerful way to move fluids around.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_one.text_2: Fluid Extractors export from connected inventories, while Fluid Pipes move fluids along.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_one.text_3: Make sure your Fluid Extractor has a redstone signal to extract!
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_one.text_4: Adjacent pipes can be disconnected with the Tinker's Hammer.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_one.text_5: When fluids in a pipe reach an intersection, they will prioritize going forward.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_one.text_6: If fluids reach a T-intersection, it will distribute fluids round-robin.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_1: There are serveral solutions for storing fluids.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_2: Vessels are inventories that hold 16 Buckets of one fluid type, and retain their contents when broken.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_3: Fluid Dials give a readout fluids in the attached inventory.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_4: A Comparator can be attached to get its power level as a redstone signal.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_5: For more fluid storage, a Reservoir stores 40 Buckets per Caminite Ring.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_6: Fluids can be pumped in and out from the bottom port using a Mechanical Core...
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_7: However a Caminite valve makes this more convenient, adding ports to the side.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_three.text_8: Caminite Gauges are decorative, and show the fluids inside of the Reservoir.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_two.text_1: Fluid Transfers can be used to filter the outputs of Fluid Pipes.
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_two.text_2: Filters can be set by right clicking an Fluid Transfer with a bucket of or vessel fluid...
kubejs.ponder.fluid_pipes_two.text_3: Letting only the filtered fluid into the attached inventory.
kubejs.ponder.forge_anvil_scene_one.head: Working the Aetherium Anvil
kubejs.ponder.forge_anvil_scene_one.text: The Aetherium Anvil harnesses heat from the Aetherium Forge to work tools and break Geodes.
Once the tool has been worked the number of times that is required, the craft will complete.
Place the item to process directly on the Anvil.
Once the Aetherium Forge reaches the required temperature for the recipe, an exclamation mark will appear above it.
When the exclamation mark is green, right click on the anvil with your Tinker's Hammer.
This will consume Aetherium Forge heat and Ember power.
Hitting the anvil when the exclamation mark is yellow will result in a strike.
Three strikes, and the item on the anvil will break
All Aetherium Anvils recipes require the Forge to be in a certain temperature range.
If the temperature leaves this range during forging, progress will be reset.
kubejs.ponder.forge_tool_station_scene_o: The Aetherium Tool Forge harnesses heat from the Aetherium Forge to craft advanced tools.
Place the item on the Tool Forge in the order specified by the recipe.
Once the Aetherium Forge reaches the required temperature for the recipe you can work the Tool Forge.
This will consume Aetherium Forge heat and Ember power.
Once the Tool Forge has been worked the number of times that is required, the craft will complete.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_1: The Mini Boiler heats up fluids and turns them into gas.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_2: Due to a bug in pondering, it will be represented by a Solidified Metal block.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_3: Unlike many other machines, the Mini Boiler does not accept Ember power...
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_4: It must be attached to a machine that produces or consumes Ember Power.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_5: Fluids such as water can be inserted into the side.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_6: Gasses can be extracted from the top of the Mini Boiler...
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_7: But cannot be stored in Fluid Vessels.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_one.text_8: Venting the gas may be needed as the Mini Boiler may explode with too much pressure!
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_1: Gasses can be used to upgrade your machines and produce Dawnstone with less Neptunium.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_2: Steam and Dwarven Gas provide the same usage for upgrades...
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_3: But Dwarven Gas burns x5 longer with x0.5 more intensity.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_4: Up to 2 Catalytic Plugs can be added to a machine to double its speed.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_5: It takes in gasses from the back.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_6: The Wildfire Stirling reduces Ember power cost by half for each connected.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_7: Both upgrades have reduced efficiency if attached through more than one Mechanical Core.
kubejs.ponder.gasses_scene_two.text_8: Dwarven Gas can also substitute Molten Gold in Dawnstone Mixing, giving x3 more Dawnstone per Neptunium.
kubejs.ponder.grapevine_pot_scene.text_1: The Grapevine Pot can be filled with a max of 6 grapes of the same type
kubejs.ponder.grapevine_pot_scene.text_2: Once filled, jump on the grapes to turn them into juice
kubejs.ponder.grapevine_pot_scene.text_3: You can then bottle the juice using empty wine bottles
kubejs.ponder.hearth_coil_scene_one.head: Smelting Using Heat
kubejs.ponder.hearth_coil_scene_one.text: The Hearth Coil smelts items dropped on top of it using Ember Power.
To supply Ember Power and take smelted items out, you'll need a Mechanical Core.
When given Ember power, the top of the coil will heat up.
Items that need smelting can then be dropped on top of the Coil.
Smelted items will be stored in the Hearth Coil and can be extracted from the bottom.
Make sure your Item Extractor has a redstone signal to extract!
kubejs.ponder.hearth_coil_scene_three.te: The Hearth Coil has three upgrades that modify the behavior of the machine.
Heat Insulation reduces the cooling speed of the Hearth Coil by 30% while increasing the max heat significantly per upgrade.
The Char Instiller limits the Hearth Coil to smoking recipes, but doubles the speed.
The Atmospheric Bellows limits the Hearth Coil to blasting recipes, but doubles the speed.
Both the Atmospheric Bellows and Char Instiller are incompatible with each other.
kubejs.ponder.hearth_coil_scene_two.head: Managing Hearth Heat
kubejs.ponder.hearth_coil_scene_two.text: Unlike many Ember Machines, the Hearth Coil will continue to draw power even if no items are smelting.
It is recommended to shut off the Hearth Coil automatically using a Clockwork Attenuator.
Using a Pressure Plate, you can detect when items are on top of the Hearth Coil to turn it on.
kubejs.ponder.ignem_reactor_scene_one.te: The Ignem Reactor turns Ember Crystals into Ember Power at up to x13 the Ember Activator.
Instead of piping items in, try inserting them one at a time when you need power using a dropper or other means.
Using Redstone, you can automate this process and preserve rare ingredients.
It requires an adjacent Combustion Chamber and Catalysis Chamber.
The Combustion and Catalysis Chambers both require their own items to run the Reactor.
At minimum, they multiply power production by x2 each...
And at maximum, x6. See JEI for the list of chamber inputs.
The Ignem Reactor itself receives Ember Crystals & Shards.
Ember can be extracted from the top using an Ember Ejector.
Make sure your Ember Ejector has a redstone signal to extract!
Unlike other Ember generators, the Ignem Reactor and Chambers can waste fuels and inputs.
kubejs.ponder.industrial_brewer_build.te: The Industrial Brewer is machine for automating Brewingstation recipes. It requires a multiblock behind it to function.
Its base layer is made up of Deepslate Counters and Deepslate Stoves.
The second layer is made up of Fluid Vessels, Kitchen Hoods, and a Big Barrel.
The third layer is made up of a Fluid Pipe and Kitchen Hood Pipes.
The final layer is made up of Fluid Pipes, Fluid Vessels, and Kitchen Hood Pipes.
kubejs.ponder.inferno_forge_scene_one.te: The Inferno Forge upgrades the Heat level of tools and armor that have full Heat.
The bottom of the Inferno Forge receives Ember power.
To start, right click the hatch on the top to open.
Make sure the heat bar on your item is filled, and toss it in alongside some Ember items.
To begin the upgrade, close the hatch.
Once finished, the hatch will automatically open.
If successful, the item will have its Heat level bar, and heat level raised by 1.
Them more Ember items you supply, the higher the chance the upgrade will be successful.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_one.text_1: Item Pipes are a simple yet powerful way to move items around.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_one.text_2: Item Extractors export from connected inventories, while Item Pipes move items along.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_one.text_3: Make sure your Item Extractor has a redstone signal to extract!
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_one.text_4: Adjacent pipes can be disconnected with the Tinker's Hammer.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_one.text_5: When an item in a pipe reaches an intersection, it will prioritize going forward.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_one.text_6: If an item reaches a T-intersection, it will distribute items round-robin.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_three.text_1: There are serveral utility blocks involved with storing and moving around items.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_three.text_2: Bins are inventories that hold a stack of one item type, and pickup items dropped on them.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_three.text_3: Item Dials give a readout of items in the attached inventory.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_three.text_4: A Comparator can be attached to get its power level as a redstone signal.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_three.text_5: Item Droppers spit out items into the world.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_three.text_6: Item Vacuums suck up items from world...
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_three.text_7: Provided they have a redstone signal.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_two.text_1: Item Transfers can be used to filter the outputs of Item Pipes.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_two.text_2: Filters can be set by right clicking an Item Transfer with an item...
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_two.text_3: Letting only the filtered item into the attached inventory.
kubejs.ponder.item_pipes_two.text_4: Since Item Pipes are an inventory, other mods can be used to filter extract from another inventory into them.
kubejs.ponder.masticator_build.text_1: The Masticator is a machine for processing items into fluids. It requires a multiblock behind it to function.
kubejs.ponder.masticator_build.text_2: Its base layer is made up of Ornamental Flesh.
kubejs.ponder.masticator_build.text_3: Its second layer is made up of Bio-Lanterns and a Modular Larynx.
Mechanical Cores act as interfaces for allowing more connections to a machine.
Larger machines may only have one port despite needing multiple inputs and outputs.
A Mechanical Core turns that one port into many.
Any item, ember, or fluid inserted into the Mechanical Core will be inserted into the machine itself.
Up to 3 Mechanical Cores can be chained together.
The Mechanical Pump slowly picks up fluids in world.
The bottom portion of the Pump receives Ember power.
Fluids such as water can be extracted from the top portion of the Pump.
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_one.text_1: The Melter breaks down items, primarily metals, into their liquid form.
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_one.text_2: The bottom portion of the Melter receives Ember power.
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_one.text_3: Items can be inserted into the top portion of the Melter.
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_one.text_4: Once melted down, fluids can be extracted through the top of the Melter.
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_one.text_5: Make sure your Fluid Extractor has a redstone signal to extract!
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_two.text_1: When processing raw ore with the Melter, you'll get more metal compared to a Furnace.
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_two.text_2: Ore blocks will multiply your yield by x2.6...
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_two.text_3: While raw ore multiplies your yield by x1.3...
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_two.text_4: Placing a Geologic Separator next to the base of the Melter will give raw ore an additional output.
kubejs.ponder.melter_scene_two.text_5: Each type of ore gives a different output. See JEI for the specifics.
kubejs.ponder.metal_former_scene_one.tex: The Metal Former harnesses heat from the Aetherium Forge to infuse Aetherium Aerosol into items.
Fluids can be bucketed or piped into it from any side.
The item you are infusing can also be manually placed or piped in.
Once the Aetherium Forge reaches the required temperature for the recipe, crafting will start.
kubejs.ponder.mixer_centrifuge_scene_one: The Mixer Centrifuge combines up to 3 different fluids to make alloys and special mixes.
The top portion of the Mixer receives Ember power.
The bottom portion of the Mixer can receive a different fluid in each face.
In this example, we will be making Molten Dawnstone.
Make sure your Fluid Extractors have a redstone signal to extract!
Once alloyed, fluids can be extracted through the top of the Mixer.
kubejs.ponder.plinth_one.text_1: The Cinder Plinth turns any item in the game into Ash.
kubejs.ponder.plinth_one.text_2: It needs Ember power to operate, and can receive it from any side.
kubejs.ponder.plinth_one.text_3: It accepts any item, but inserting a trash item such as Cobblestone is recommended.
kubejs.ponder.plinth_one.text_4: By default, the Cinder Plinth spits out items in-world...
kubejs.ponder.plinth_one.text_5: But a Bin beneath it will catch all the Ash.
kubejs.ponder.power_storage_scene_one.te: Ember power can be stored in multiple ways.
A Copper Cell stores 24,000 Ember power, and retains its power when broken.
Its power level can be read using an Ember Dial.
A Comparator can be attached to get its power level as a redstone signal.
For more power storage, a Crystal Cell stores 64,000 Ember power.
To insert and extract power, you'll need a Mechanical Core on the bottom.
To upgrade the Crystal Cells's storage capacity, insert Ember fuel items using a Hopper or Pipe.
The maximum storage of the Crystal Cell is 1,440,000 Ember.
kubejs.ponder.power_transmission_scene_o: Once Ember power is generated, there are a few ways to transport it around.
Ember can be extracted from a generator such as the Ember Activator using an Ember Emitter...
And can be inserted using an Ember Receptor.
With everything in place, link the Emitter to the Receptor with your Tinker's Hammer.
Make sure your Ember Emitter has a redstone signal to extract!
kubejs.ponder.power_transmission_scene_t: Basic Ember Emitters and Receptors aren't the only options for transporting power.
The transfer rate of Ember can be improved by x10 by using Ember Ejectors and Funnels.
Ember Relays and Mirror Relays extend the distance of Ember power bursts, preventing power loss.
Beam Splitters can take in two inputs and send out two outputs.
The larger ports act as Ember Emitters, and the smaller ones as Ember Receptors.
kubejs.ponder.pressure_refinery_scene_on: The Pressure Refinery turns Ember Crystals into Ember Power at up to x4 the Ember Activator.
The block below the Refinery is the multiplier block.
At minimum, it multiplies power production by x1.5...
And at maximum, x4. See JEI for the list of multiplier blocks.
The bottom portion of the Pressure Refinery receives Ember Crystals & Shards...
As well as a constant supply of water.
Finally, the multiplier block must be surrounded by lava or fire.
Ember can be extracted from the top using an Ember Emitter.
Make sure your Ember Emitter has a redstone signal to extract!
kubejs.ponder.primordial_cradle_scene_on: The Primordial Cradle births Flesh Blobs that can be cultivated and slain for Living Flesh.
Right click or toss raw meat into the cradle to feed it.
Once filled with flesh, the cradle needs a Potion of Health, Regeneration or Golden Apple to digest.
If successful, the cradle will birth a Flesh Blob!
They can be fattened up by feeding them with raw meat...
And then killed for their living flesh!
There is a chance, however, that the birthing fails and primordial energy leaks out from the cradle...
Cull the flesh before it spreads, or let it run wild and reap the rewards.
kubejs.ponder.primordial_cradle_scene_tw: When fed, the Primordial Cradle has a set chance to create a Flesh Blob.
This behavior can be modified by feeding it various items!
For example, feeding the cradle Spider Eyes will give it a chance to create a Hungry Flesh Blob.
Hungry Flesh Blobs actively seek out mobs to kill and grow in size
Adding living flesh may birth something more primordial...
If you're looking to force the cradle to fail and grow, toss in some rotten flesh.
Experiment with different items, like that fleshcrafter you are...
kubejs.ponder.prism_scene_one.text_1: The Refraction Prism is the key to harvesting Aetherium from moonlight.
kubejs.ponder.prism_scene_one.text_2: To start, place a Fluid Vessel extended with Caminite Supports and topped with the Refraction Prism itself.
kubejs.ponder.prism_scene_one.text_3: The Prism will also need to be surrounded by 8 pillars of Archaic Bricks and Archaic Edges.
kubejs.ponder.prism_scene_one.text_4: The taller pillars must be topped by Moonlight Amplifiers facing the Prism.
kubejs.ponder.prism_scene_one.text_5: Once formed, blue runes should appear on the pillars, and the Fluid Vessel should start filling with Impure Aetherium Sludge at night.
kubejs.ponder.prism_scene_one.text_6: To increase the rate of gathering, up to 4 Aetherium Focusing Matrices can be placed on the shorter pillars.
kubejs.ponder.source_terrarium_build.tex: The Source Terrarium is a machine for automating crop growth. It requires a multiblock behind it to function.
Its base layer is made up of Sourcestone: Large Bricks and a Planter.
The second layer contains an Agronomic Sourcelink and Depth Glass.
The third layer is filled with Depth Glass.
The final layer is made up of Sourcestone: Large Bricks Slabs.
kubejs.ponder.stamper_one.text_1: The Stamper is a combination machine that stamps liquids into items.
kubejs.ponder.stamper_one.text_2: The top block is the Stamper itself and needs Ember power to operate.
kubejs.ponder.stamper_one.text_3: The bottom block is the Stamper Base that receives fluids such as molten metals.
kubejs.ponder.stamper_one.text_4: The Stamper requires a Stamp to operate depending on the recipe.
kubejs.ponder.stamper_one.text_5: By default, the Stamper spits out items in-world...
kubejs.ponder.stamper_one.text_6: But a Bin beneath the Stamper Base will catch all Stamped items.
kubejs.ponder.stamper_one.text_7: For some recipes such as the Iron Aspectus, the Stamper Base itself will need an item as well.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_1: Translocators are versatile devices to transfer items and fluids between inventories.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_2: Since they are placed in the same block space, they do not render correctly here and will be represented by the Iron Block.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_3: To select which inventory to insert into, right click its respective Translocator nub.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_4: They can also be filtered by right clicking on the main part.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_5: Translocators can be upgraded with Glowstone Dust to transfer stacks at a time.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_6: Adding a Neptunium Ingot puts it in regulate mode. It will maintain a certain amount of items set in the filter in the inventory it's attached to.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_7: They can also be upgraded with Redstone Dust for redstone control.
kubejs.ponder.translocator_scene.text_8: Finally, adding an Iron Ingot makes the Translocator emit a redstone signal to the inventory if it can't insert.
kubejs.ponder.unholy_cradle_build.text_1: The Unholy Cradle for creating Flesh Blob spawn eggs. It requires a multiblock behind it to function.
kubejs.ponder.unholy_cradle_build.text_2: Its base layer is made up of Packed Flesh and Packed Flesh Walls.
kubejs.ponder.unholy_cradle_build.text_3: Its second layer is made up of Malignant Flesh Blocks, Ornamental Flesh blocks, and Bloomlights.
kubejs.ponder.unholy_cradle_build.text_4: Its third layer is made up of Packed Flesh and a Primordial Cradle.
kubejs.ponder.unholy_cradle_build.text_5: Its fourth layer is made up of Packed Flesh Walls.
kubejs.ponder.unholy_cradle_build.text_6: The final layer is adorned with Flesh Spikes.
